content: This was approved last week but was waiting on a dependency on #10689. That merged 2 days ago and the robot marked the dependency as resolved, but it still has a pending check Dependent Issues Pending â€” Blocked by #10689. Do I just need to be patient, or does something need to be done to give the robot a nudge?

Once the dependencies get merged, a maintainer should take a final look to ensure the remaining code will merge cleanly. So indeed, Bors needs to be given a nudge before something happens. By the way, your PR dropped of the maintainers' radar because you removed the awaiting-review tag.

More generally, any branch that has had a green checkmark for a couple of minutes is probably not going to be updated, so feel free to poke the maintainers a bit sooner next time! :)
Ah, I thought that once the checks had cleared it was just a matter of waiting to resolve the dependency, which is why I took off the label. Thanks for explaining and for nudging!

On the subject of "Intermediate PRing" lessons: if a reviewer has used the "request changes" facility on a PR rather than just commenting to suggest changes (e.g. in #10540) do I have to flip some switch to confirm that the changes have been made, beyond just resolving the relevant conversations?
The "request changes" flag can only be unflipped by the person who set it, but also isn't noticed by bors
Oh dear, I didn't know it could be unflipped - can you onlu dom that by making another review?
There's a "dismiss stale review" button you can click

So is it considered rude or impatient to click the "Re-request review" button when the requested changes are completed, or is this a useful thing to do? Is it like standing at reception repeatedly pinging the bell for service?!

This is a good question which can best be answered by the maintainers, but my 2 cents as a contributor is that if I think everything's done and the ball is in the maintainer's court then I just make sure my PR is on the #queue (ie make sure it compiles and it's tagged "awaiting review") and then I forget about it. They're really busy.

@Stuart Presnell If your PR has been on the #queue for > 24 hrs, I think it's fine to give a polite ping (the request-review-button is fine for that, but you can also use this stream on zulip). Especially if you have other stuff that depends on this PR.
I guess if you start "pinging the bell for service" multiple times per day, we would quickly let you know to calm down :smiley:
